item.description:
It is estimated that 50% of South Korean women and an increasing number of men in their 20's have some form of plastic surgery performed in the quest for the perfect face. Director Kim Ki-Duk examines this phenomenon in the fictional movie "Time". Seh-hee fears that her relationship with her long-time boyfriend is failing and disappears to have cosmetic surgery.

Here is a complete review: http://www.theaspectr...

As is custom, I will hold up a Meet-up sign near the front row after the film and then off to a local cafe where I am sure a lively discussion will ensue.

This took me totally by surprise and so here are some links that discuss this further:

http://english.ohmyne...

http://www.seoulstyle...

from Time Magazine : http://www.time.com/t...

Equally disturbing: http://news.scotsman....

This meetup will be hosted by Tom
item.name: Plastic Surgery in South Korea
